sections.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Scope)
sections.content:
These Terms of Service (hereinafter referred to as "the Terms") apply to all users (hereinafter referred to as "Users") who use the web application "AI Picture Book Maker" (hereinafter referred to as "the Service") operated by our company (hereinafter referred to as "the Company"). sections.heading: Article 2 (Definitions)
sections.content:
The meanings of terms used in these Terms are defined as follows:

1. "the Service" refers to the web application "AI Picture Book Maker" provided by the Company, which consists of features such as AI-powered automatic picture book generation, a credit-based payment system, and community functions.
2. "User" refers to any individual or legal entity that views or uses the Service.
3. "Logged-in User" refers to a User who has registered an account through the procedure defined by the Company and is logged in using an email address and password or OAuth authentication.
4. "Credit" refers to a prepaid virtual currency used for functions such as page generation in the Service. Users can purchase Credits through payment methods such as Stripe.

sections.heading: Article 3 (Account Registration and Management)
sections.content:
1. Registration Process
   Users must register an account by entering the required information, such as an email address and password, in accordance with the procedures set forth by the Company. The Company may refuse registration if the applicant has a history of account suspension for violations of these Terms or similar reasons.

2. Use by Minors
   If a minor uses the Service, they must obtain prior consent from their legal guardian (e.g., parent or guardian). The Company may refuse service if it cannot verify such consent when necessary.

3. Account Management
   Users are responsible for managing their login information (email address, password, etc.) and are prohibited from transferring, lending, or misusing their account information to third parties. The Company is not responsible for any unauthorized use by third parties unless caused by intentional or gross negligence on the part of the User.

4. Account Modification and Deletion
   Users can change their registration information or withdraw (delete their account) in accordance with the procedures set by the Company. The handling of remaining Credits upon account deletion shall be governed by Article 7.

sections.heading: Article 4 (Credits and Payment)
sections.content:
1. Purchase of Credits
   Users can purchase Credits by paying the specified amount using payment methods such as Stripe on the purchase screen within the Service (e.g., 1,000 Credits for $10). Once the purchase is complete, the Credits will be immediately reflected in the User's account.

2. Use and Consumption of Credits
   When using the picture book page generation feature, 20 Credits are consumed per page. The same consumption applies for regenerating images or adding pages. If the Credit balance is insufficient, generation cannot proceed and additional Credits must be purchased.

3. Validity and Refunds of Credits
   Unless otherwise specified by the Company, Credits do not expire. In the event of account deletion or withdrawal, unused Credits will not be refunded (except as otherwise required by law).

4. Credit History Inquiry
   Users can check their Credit balance as well as purchase and consumption history at any time within the Service.

sections.heading: Article 5 (Picture Book Generation Function)
sections.content:
1. Generation Process
   Based on the number of pages, theme, etc. specified by the User, a large language model (such as GPT) generates the title and text, and subsequently, Stable AI generates images. Users can preview the results and regenerate if necessary, but Credits will be consumed each time.

2. Quality and Consistency of Generated Content
   The Company does not guarantee the accuracy, usefulness, or consistency of the output from the AI models. Since the output may contain misinformation or inappropriate expressions, Users are responsible for regenerating or modifying the content at their own risk.

3. Saving and Editing
   The generated picture book can be saved by the User at their discretion. Even after saving, further regeneration or editing is possible, but additional Credit consumption may occur.

sections.heading: Article 6 (Community Function)
sections.content:
1. Publication Settings for Works
   Users can choose to post their generated picture books to the community with settings such as "Public", "Unlisted", or "Private". Unlisted works can only be viewed by those who have the URL.

2. Viewing and Reactions
   Guest users can only view the cover and title, while logged-in users can view all pages and use features such as commenting and liking (subject to additional conditions set by the Company).

3. Prohibited Content
   Posts that contain content violating public order and morals, infringing on the rights of third parties, or containing slander, discrimination, violence, or obscene expressions, as determined inappropriate by the Company, are prohibited.

4. Handling of Violating Works
   If the Company determines that a User's post violates these Terms or applicable laws, it may take measures such as deleting the offending work or suspending the User's account.

sections.heading: Article 7 (Account Suspension and Handling Upon Withdrawal)
sections.content:
1. Account Suspension
   The Company may suspend or delete a User's account without prior notice if it determines that the User has violated these Terms or engaged in problematic behavior such as violations of applicable laws.

2. Credits Upon Withdrawal
   Even if a User voluntarily withdraws, any unused Credits at the time of account deletion will be forfeited and will not be refunded (except as otherwise required by law).

3. Handling of Saved Data
   After withdrawal, any picture books or community posts saved by the User may be deleted. The Company does not guarantee that content already cited or downloaded by other users can be completely removed.

privacyPage.title: AI Picture Book Maker Privacy Policy

sections.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Scope)
sections.content:
This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as "the Policy") sets forth the handling of personal information obtained from Users (all individuals or legal entities using the Service) in connection with the web application "AI Picture Book Maker" (hereinafter referred to as "the Service") provided by the Company (hereinafter referred to as "the Company"). Users must agree to this Policy in order to use the Service.

1. The purpose of this Policy is to establish the rights and obligations between the Company and Users with respect to the personal information and related data handled in the Service.
2. The Terms of Service and other regulations (hereinafter referred to as "Individual Provisions") set forth separately are considered part of this Policy and shall take precedence in case of any conflict with this Policy.
3. If a User does not agree to this Policy, they may not use the Service.

sections.heading: Article 2 (Information Collected)
sections.content:
In the operation of the Service, the Company may collect the following personal information or related data:

1. Account registration information: information voluntarily provided by the User, such as email address, password, and username.
2. Usage history of the Service: picture books, images, comments, like history, and credit purchase/consumption history.
3. Technical information: device information, browser information, IP address, and log information obtained through cookies or similar technologies.
4. Inquiry and support information: information that Users enter and submit when using inquiry forms, etc.

sections.heading: Article 3 (Purpose of Information Use)
sections.content:
The Company uses the collected information for the following purposes:

1. To provide and operate the Service.
2. For user authentication and account management (password reset, account settings, etc.).
3. To improve the quality of the Service, develop features, and analyze usage.
4. To handle inquiries and support requests from Users.
5. To take measures against actions that violate laws or the Terms of Service, and for necessary security measures.
6. For marketing activities and campaign notifications (only if the User has consented).

sections.heading: Article 4 (Cookies and Tracking Technologies)
sections.content: The Company uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to enhance User convenience and improve the Service. Users may refuse to accept cookies via their browser settings; however, this may result in some features of the Service not being available.

sections.heading: Article 5 (Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties)
sections.content:
The Company will not provide personal information of Users to third parties except in the following cases:

1. When the User has given consent.
2. When disclosure is required in accordance with laws.
3. When it is necessary to protect the life, body, or property of a person and it is difficult to obtain the User's consent.
4. In the event of a business transfer, merger, etc., where personal information is transferred (in which case, the Company will require the successor to continue managing the information in accordance with this Policy).

sections.heading: Article 6 (Security Measures)
sections.content: The Company will take necessary and appropriate measures to prevent leakage, loss, or damage of personal information and ensure security. The Company will also appropriately supervise employees who handle personal information and, in the event of a security incident, promptly respond, investigate the extent of the impact and the cause, and implement measures to prevent recurrence.

sections.heading: Article 7 (User Rights)
sections.content:
1. Users may request access to, correction, deletion, or suspension of the use of their personal information held by the Company. To make such requests, please follow the procedures specified in the Service's inquiry form or as otherwise designated by the Company.
2. Even if a User deletes their account, the Company may retain data for a necessary period to comply with laws or to prevent disputes. After the retention period, the Company will appropriately dispose of or delete the data.

sections.heading: Article 8 (Changes to the Policy)
sections.content:
1. The Company may change this Policy at any time without the User's consent. However, if the changes significantly affect the rights of Users, the Company will notify them in an appropriate manner (e.g., via a notice on the Service or by email) prior to the changes taking effect.
2. If a User continues to use the Service after the changes take effect, they are deemed to have agreed to the changes.

sections.heading: Article 9 (Contact Information)
sections.content: For inquiries regarding this Policy or questions/concerns about the handling of personal information, please contact us using the inquiry form designated by the Company.
